title: "What is the history behind Donato's work in mesmerism and animal magnetism?"
first_phrase: This text tells the story of the medical student who becomes enthralled with the power of hypnosis, convinced that even a healthy person like Lucile must be sick. His overzealousness creates whispers that he is a "stooge," and when he meets Donato, a famous hypnotist, he is put in his place with witty irony. This leads to a discussion about the concept of "fascination," which Doctor Bremaud has used on healthy men to induce a state of stupor. Donato's work is of great importance in the history of hypnotism and animal magnetism.

last_phrase: In conclusion, Donato's work in mesmerism and animal magnetism was crucial in the history of hypnotism. By providing evidence of the reality of somnambulism and other remarkable phenomena, Donato challenged the scientific societies' condemnation of these practices. While previous processes had been discouragingly slow and laborious, Donato's discovery allowed for more effective and convincing demonstrations.
